utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I Ross...

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Take thee, Emily...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Take thee, Rachel... Emily. Emily.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Uhh...Shall I go on?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He-he said Rachel, right? Do you think I should go up there?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Yes, yes, do go on.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: I think we’d better start again. Ross, repeat after me. I, Ross…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I, Ross…

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Take thee, EM-I-LY…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Take thee, Emily. Like there’d be anybody else.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, until death parts us. Really, I do. Emily.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: May I have the rings? Emily, place this ring on Ross’s finger as a symbol of your bond everlasting. Ross, place this ring in Emily’s hand as a symbol of the love that encircles you forever.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Happy too.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Ross and Emily have made their declarations and it gives me great pleasure to declare them husband and wife.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: You may kiss the bride.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: This is worse than when he married the lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Just keep smiling.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, that went well. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It could’ve been worse, he could’ve shot her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That uh, that was pretty funny. Wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You’ve spoiled everything! It’s like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That-that-that’s all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I’ll be right out here. She’s just fixing her makeup.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I hate you!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And, I love you!!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Boy, bad time to say the wrong name, huh Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s true, thanks dad. People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Yes, Waltham interiors.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller’s personal physician, Dr. Philange.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve discovered that Ross forgot to take his brain medicine, uh, now without it, uh, in the brain of Ross, uh women’s names are interchangeable, through-through no fault of his own.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Oh my God, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, not Phoebe, Dr. Philange. Oh no! You have it too!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh wow, I hope you don’t take this the wrong way but, I know we had plans to meet up tonight and, ugh, I’m just kinda worried about what it might do to our friendship.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. How could we have let this happen?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Seven times!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh! Well, y’know, we were away…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: In a foreign, romantic country…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I blame London.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bad London!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So look umm, while we’re st-still in London, I mean, we can keep doing it right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I don’t see that we have a choice. But, when we’re back home, we don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Only here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know, I saw a wine cellar downstairs…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll meet you there in two minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mon, honey, I gotta ask you something.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross said my name up there, I mean, come on, I just can’t pretend that didn’t happen can I?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I-I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, what should I do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just uh, do the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa, wait, listen, I think I’m just gonna talk to Ross about what he think it meant.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait. Rachel, no, he’s married. Married! If you don’t realize that, I can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you’re right. You’re right. You can’t help me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Jack, is it all our fault? Were we bad parents?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh yeah, well who serves steak when there’s no place to sit, I mean how are you supposed to eat this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Where were you? We were supposed to meet in the wine cellar?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Forget it, that’s off.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why?!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, what are you doing? You promised Phoebe you wouldn’t eat meat until she has the babies!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I figured we’re in another country, so it doesn’t count.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The man’s got a point.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi. Sorry, things aren’t working out so well.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no! It could be better, but it’s gonna be okay, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Of course, I mean, she’s gonna get over this, y’know? I mean, so you said my name! Y’know you just said it ‘cause you saw me there, if you’d have seen a circus freak, you would’ve said, "I take thee circus freak." Y’know, it didn’t mean anything, it’s just a mistake. It didn’t mean anything. Right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! Of course it didn’t mean anything! I mean, uh well, I can understand why Emily would think it meant something, y’know, because-because it was you…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But it absolutely didn’t. It didn’t!! It didn’t!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross, hey, the band’s ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Oh-oh, the band’s ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says—I don’t care about the stupid band!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You spit on me man!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Emily is kinda taking a long time, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know when I locked myself in the bathroom at my wedding, it was because I was trying to pop the window out of the frame.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, right!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Get the hell out of there, y’know?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emily? Emily? I’m coming in.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, look at that, same thing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen, in the middle of everything if I scream the word, "Yippee!" just ignore me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, Rachel! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, hello Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross said my name. Okay? My name. Ross said my name up there that obviously means that he still loves me! Okay, don’t believe me, I know I’m right—do you guys want to go downstairs and get a drink?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, we do. But, we have to change first.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, I want to change. And why-why don’t you go down and get us a table?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ll be down in like five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fifteen minutes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello? Oh, Pheebs! It’s Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yay…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Great…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, so what happened?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, Ross said my name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, but I don’t think that means anything.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Pheebs, y’know what, let’s look at this objectively all right? Ninth grade, right? The obsession starts. All right? The summer after ninth grade he sees me in a two-piece for the first time, his obsession begins to grow. So then…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, listen, why don’t we go change in my room?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But my clothes are—ohh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, you look…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No time for that!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, dude, let me in. I got a girl out here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I’ve got a girl in here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No you don’t, I just saw you go in there with Monica!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, we’re-we’re hanging out in here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, which one of us is gonna be having sex in there, me or you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I suppose I’d have to say you!! But, what if we’re watching a movie in here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Which we are, and-and we already paid for it. It’s My Giant!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: My Giant? I love that movie!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You really think this is okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, Ross and Emily aren’t gonna use it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, it’s so beautiful. Ohh! Y’know, I-I don’t know if I feel right about this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh Mon-Mon-Mon-Mon-look, this is the honeymoon suite. The room expects sex. The room would be disappointed if it didn’t get sex. All of the other honeymoon suites would think it was a loser.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emily?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nope, not under here!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You didn’t find her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I’ve looked everywhere!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you couldn’t have looked everywhere or else you would’ve found her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I think you should keep looking!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, for about 30 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Or 45.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, in 45 minutes you can find her twice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! For all I know, she’s trying to find me but couldn’t because I kept moving around. No, from now on, I’m staying in one place. Right here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it’s getting late.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Actually, do you guys mind staying here for a while?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh, y’know, umm we gotta get up early and catch that plane for New York.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a very large plane.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s cool.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But, we’ll stay here with you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks guys! I really appreciate this, y’know, but you don’t have to rub my butt.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We have to leave for New York in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, I’ve been looking at those doors, they look pretty sound proof, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We can’t do that that’s insane. I mean ‘A’ he could wake up and ‘B’ y’know, let’s go for it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Em-Emily? Em-Emily? Emily!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: You can forget about Emily, she’s not with us.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: We’ve come for her things.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait, well wh-wh-wh-where is she?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: She’s in hiding. She’s utterly humiliated. She doesn’t want to see you ever again.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: We’re very sad that it didn’t work out between you and Emily, monkey. But, I think you’re absolutely delicious.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Excuse me, I’m standing right here!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Oh yes, there you are.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey-hey, you guys oh hurry up, get some, there’s a whole cart outside…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Goodbye Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now, hold on! Hold on! Look, look, your daughter and I are supposed to leave tonight for our honeymoon, now-now you-you tell her that I’m gonna be at that airport and I hope that she’ll be there too! Oh yeah, I said Rachel’s name, but it didn’t mean anything, Okay? She’s-she’s just a friend and that’s all! That’s all! Now just tell Emily that I love her and that I can’t imagine spending my life with anyone else. Please, promise me that you’ll tell her that.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: All right, I’ll tell her. Come on bugger face!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Call me.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: You spend half your life in the bathroom, why don’t you ever go out the bloody window!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, maybe it’s best that we never got to do it again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it kinda makes that-that one night special. Y’know, technically we still are over international waters.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m gonna go to the bathroom, maybe I’ll see you there in a bit?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ‘Kay!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uhh, no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Felicity and I, we’re watching My Giant, and I was thinking, "I’m never gonna be as good an actor as that giant." Do you think I’m just wasting my life with this acting thing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean, the giant is like five years younger than me, y’know, you think I’ll ever get there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks man.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But what about how much taller he is than me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean, there’s no way I can make myself taller now, y’know? And who knows what science will come up with in the future, but Chandler, what if I die an unsuccessful, regular sized man?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Monica, wow you’ve been in the bathroom for like a half-hour.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Had the beef-tips, huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You ate meat! You had sex!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No we didn’t!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know you didn’t, I was talking about Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, I did not have sex.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This pregnancy is throwing me all off.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I’m gonna go say hi the chick and the duck.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, me too!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would you need to say hi to them, you’ve been feeding them for four days?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh right, maybe I’ll just go home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, we certainly are alone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! Good thing we have that, ‘Not in New York’ rule.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Right. Umm, listen since we’re-we-re on that subject, umm, I just wanted to tell you that uh, well, I-I was going through a really hard time in London, what with my brother getting married and that guy thinking I was Ross’s mother…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, an-anyway, I just—that night meant a lot to me, I guess I’m just trying to say thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh. Y’know, that night meant a lot to me too, and it wasn’t because I was in a bad place or anything, it just meant a lot to me ‘cause, you’re really hot! Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And I’m cute too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And you’re cute too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you! All right, I gotta go unpack.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m still on London time, does that count?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That counts!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, good!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach! Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! What are you, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I-I-I’ve been on Standby for a flight home for hours.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, so no sign of Emily huh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So umm, what time are you supposed to leave?

utterance.speaker: Gate Agent
utterance.content: This is the last call for Flight 1066 to Athens. The last call.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pretty soon I guess.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I just, I don’t understand, I mean, how-how can she do this? Y’know, what, am I, am I like a complete idiot for thinking that she’d actually show up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, you’re not an idiot, Ross. You’re a guy very much in love.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Same difference.

utterance.speaker: Gate Agent
utterance.content: All ticketed passengers for Flight 1066 to Athens should now be on board.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I get it! Well, that’s that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, you know what, I think you should go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. I think you should go, by yourself, get some distance, clear your head, I think it’d be really good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t, I don’t, I don’t know…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, come on Ross! I think it would be really good for you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I could, yeah, I can do that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can’t, I can’t even believe her! No, y’know what, I am, I am gonna go!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know—thanks!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll see you back at home, if I ever get a flight out of here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, well…nah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why don’t you come, I mean, I-I have two tickets, why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well-well, I don’t know Ross—really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, it’ll be great! You can, you can lay on the beach and I can cry over my failed marriage. See-see how I make jokes?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No really, I mean, I mean, God, I could use a friend.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow, uh okay, uh maybe. Umm, yes, I can do that!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Cool!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on! Here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay, we’re going. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah! Ah! I forgot my jacket!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, wait-wait-wait…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You tell them to wait!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Wait! Wait!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emily.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no! Oh-no! No! No! Emily!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahh, yes, I will have a glass of the Merlot and uh, he will have a white wine spritzer. Woo! Hey, look at that, the airport’s moving. Hey, are we moving?! Are we moving? Why are we moving? Hey, time-out, umm, yeah, does the captain know that we’re moving? Oh my God. Oh, my gosh.
